summary: Based on the provided documents, there appears to be a misunderstanding in the entity name. The documents refer to Alan G. Sentinella, a retired FBI Special Agent, not Al Miller. Alan G. Sentinella testified before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) on May 21, 1975, regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. His testimony covered topics such as electronic surveillance and potential communist influence related to these individuals and organizations. The documents consistently summarize his testimony before the SSC on the same date, focusing on the same subjects.
significance: The documents do not provide any information about Al Miller or Alan G. Sentinella's role or significance in the JFK assassination context. The documents focus on his testimony regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the SCLC, and Stanley Levison.
